intro: Dombeya ambalabeensis subsp. analavelonae, commonly known as the Madagascar dombeya, is a shrub native to the eastern regions of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has hairy leaves and stems, which are typical features of the genus Dombeya. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. This subspecies is noted for its ornamental value and is of interest to botanists due to its unique geographical distribution.
